2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and snacks. Later tonight, Jack and his friends are planning to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, his father lost his job at the shipyard. The news hit their family hard, and Jack felt the weight of responsibility settle on his young shoulders. He took on extra shifts at the local fish market, his hands growing rough and calloused as he unloaded crates and gutted fish, determined to help his family weather the storm.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a hardworking and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones, particularly watching sporting events.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at the pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling excited and anticipatory about watching the European football cup game with his friends at the pub later.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends. He plans to watch a soccer game later tonight.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends. He plans to watch a soccer game later tonight.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and snacks. Later tonight, Jack and his friends are planning to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

He took on extra shifts at the local fish market, his hands growing rough and calloused as he unloaded crates and gutted fish, determined to help his family weather the storm.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself backstage at The Black Swan, helping his friend Jack set up for a local band's performance. The air buzzed with anticipation, the smell of stale beer and sawdust a comforting familiarity. Witnessing the raw energy of the musicians, the way their music seemed to electrify the crowd, ignited a spark in William, a yearning to create something that could bring people together like this.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the coast. They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual struggling with deep-seated insecurities despite his privileged upbringing and close friendships.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and excited.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.

As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual struggling with deep-seated insecurities despite his privileged upbringing and close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon outdoors before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the company of his friends and his tendency to withdraw into himself due to his insecurities.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the company of his friends and his tendency to withdraw into himself due to his insecurities.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have.           Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxed afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be assessing the situation, observing the dynamics between his friends, and subtly maneuvering to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for dinner and drinks before the game.

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.



          This plan allows for a mix of social activities, personal time, and relaxation, all while keeping Alice Lewis's goal of having a good time at the forefront. It also includes some flexibility to accommodate any unexpected opportunities or changes in plans.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling some pain and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling some pain and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be assessing the situation, observing the dynamics between his friends, and subtly maneuvering to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling some pain and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Black Swan, using a combination of persuasion and subtle influence.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself backstage at The Black Swan, helping his friend Jack set up for a local band's performance. The air buzzed with anticipation, the smell of stale beer and sawdust a comforting familiarity. Witnessing the raw energy of the musicians, the way their music seemed to electrify the crowd, ignited a spark in William, a yearning to create something that could bring people together like this.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the coast. They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself backstage at The Black Swan, helping his friend Jack set up for a local band's performance. The air buzzed with anticipation, the smell of stale beer and sawdust a comforting familiarity. Witnessing the raw energy of the musicians, the way their music seemed to electrify the crowd, ignited a spark in William, a yearning to create something that could bring people together like this.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the coast. They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, his father lost his job at the shipyard. The news hit their family hard, and Jack felt the weight of responsibility settle on his young shoulders. He took on extra shifts at the local fish market, his hands growing rough and calloused as he unloaded crates and gutted fish, determined to help his family weather the storm.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the thrill of the game.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling excited and anticipatory about watching the football game with his friends at The Black Swan.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
