        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely struggle to make a decision, torn between his desire to please his friends and his own preferences.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely struggle to make a decision, torn between his desire to please his friends and his own preferences.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.

As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

          current daily occupation: likely unemployed and living off of inherited wealth.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement about spending time with his friends and apprehension about his own insecurities.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
    Active player

          Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a leisurely morning at a market.

          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia later that evening.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          * Stay connected with friends and family.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and sipping coffee while enjoying the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Chain of thought

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the thrill of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a leisurely morning at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and sipping coffee while enjoying the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

          Queries

        • core characteristics: a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and perhaps a little wistful.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and assertive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing mild disappointment and fatigue while spending time with friends at a market. They are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and assertive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with his friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          **May 16th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying coffee and pastries at a market with friends. Later that night, her friends are debating where to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and multifaceted individual who values friendship and enjoys social outings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying a pleasant morning with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**
          * [17:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for pre-game drinks and snacks.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Crooked Billet with friends.

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex individual who enjoys spending time with her friends and has a strong preference for her favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. While she can be manipulative and ambitious, as seen in her teenage years, she also values companionship and seeks to have a good time with those she cares about.
          current daily occupation: likely retired or working a part-time job given her age and the context of the provided information.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games and socializing at markets. He seems to prefer The Black Swan pub but is open to other suggestions from his friends.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of William Jones:

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games and socializing at markets. He seems to prefer The Black Swan pub but is open to other suggestions from his friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker

    • The Black Swan

          Value

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be assessing the situation, observing the dynamics between his friends, and subtly maneuvering to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, likely with friends, and is about to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is deciding where to go watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely struggle to make a decision, torn between his desire to please his friends and his own preferences.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

          current daily occupation: likely retired and spends his days socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: showing signs of wanting to connect with his friends and enjoy life more.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends at pubs.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who is both ambitious and sociable. At a young age, she demonstrated a willingness to manipulate others to achieve her goals, showing a cunning and perhaps ruthless side. However, she also values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group, preferring to socialize at her favorite pub. She seems to appreciate the finer things in life, like good food and drink, and enjoys lively atmospheres.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          **May 15th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consider her options and choose a pub based on her preferences and the suggestions of her friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Crooked Billet with friends.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends at pubs.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who is both ambitious and sociable. At a young age, she demonstrated a willingness to manipulate others to achieve her goals, showing a cunning and perhaps ruthless side. However, she also values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group, preferring to socialize at her favorite pub. She seems to appreciate the finer things in life, like good food and drink, and enjoys lively atmospheres.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
        TimeDisplay

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the excitement of the game.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker was recently seen relaxing with friends at Victoria Park but may be feeling left out as his friends are making plans to watch a game without him.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
