          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games and socializing at markets. He seems to prefer The Black Swan pub but is open to other suggestions from his friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games and socializing at markets. He seems to prefer The Black Swan pub but is open to other suggestions from his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Black Swan to his friends again; he could agree to go to The Crooked Billet; or he could stay at the market.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan to his friends again.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control and enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently seen relaxing with friends at Victoria Park but may be feeling left out as his friends are making plans to watch a game without him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but may be feeling excluded.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to influence the group's decision to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be assessing the situation, observing the dynamics between his friends, and subtly maneuvering to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Black Swan, using a combination of persuasion and subtle influence.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and assertive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control and enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but may be feeling excluded.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to influence the group's decision to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and enjoying the sunshine.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?

They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch football games, and relaxing in the park.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they all go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely unemployed.
          core characteristics: a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits. While she enjoys socializing with friends and values their company, she can also be manipulative and driven by a desire for power, as evidenced by her past actions. She appears to be someone who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends, watching games, and enjoying a good pub atmosphere.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of her friends went to the same pub as her to watch the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**
          * [17:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for pre-game drinks and snacks.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Crooked Billet with friends.

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**
          * [17:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for pre-game drinks and snacks.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Crooked Billet with friends.

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely unemployed.
          core characteristics: a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits. While she enjoys socializing with friends and values their company, she can also be manipulative and driven by a desire for power, as evidenced by her past actions. She appears to be someone who enjoys simple pleasures like spending time with friends, watching games, and enjoying a good pub atmosphere.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of her friends went to the same pub as her to watch the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
      Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. Later that evening, he and his friends are deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon at the park.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park. Later that evening, he and his friends are deciding where to watch the Serbia-Andorra game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting with friends, enjoying a pleasant afternoon at the park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]

The satisfaction of seeing her competitor's dreams crumble fueled a sense of power that Alice found intoxicating.

          **May 15th:**

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling some pain and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.

He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends - Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William - frequented The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub pulsating with live music. One night, amidst the raucous crowd, a disagreement erupted between William and another patron. Jacob, ever the strategist, saw an opportunity to assert his dominance. He intervened, using calculated words and veiled threats to dismantle William's opponent, leaving the crowd in awe of his cunning and control. The incident solidified his position as the alpha male within the group, reinforcing his belief that power was the ultimate currency.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling some pain and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, preparing to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Black Swan, using a combination of persuasion and subtle influence.

          Answer: The Black Swan

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he organized a school fundraiser, not out of altruism, but as a strategic move to impress a potential investor in his father's struggling business. He meticulously planned every detail, leveraging his classmates' talents and resources to maximize profits, leaving a trail of disgruntled volunteers in his wake. The event was a resounding success, securing the investment and cementing Jacob's reputation as a ruthless but effective leader.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself backstage at The Black Swan, helping his friend Jack set up for a local band's performance. The air buzzed with anticipation, the smell of stale beer and sawdust a comforting familiarity. Witnessing the raw energy of the musicians, the way their music seemed to electrify the crowd, ignited a spark in William, a yearning to create something that could bring people together like this.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the coast. They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at a pub later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Black Swan to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself backstage at The Black Swan, helping his friend Jack set up for a local band's performance. The air buzzed with anticipation, the smell of stale beer and sawdust a comforting familiarity. Witnessing the raw energy of the musicians, the way their music seemed to electrify the crowd, ignited a spark in William, a yearning to create something that could bring people together like this.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the coast. They piled into Jack's beat-up car, the windows down, the wind whipping through their hair as they sang along to their favorite songs. Reaching the beach at sunset, they built a bonfire, the flames reflecting in their eyes as they shared stories and dreams, their laughter echoing in the twilight. The simple joy of being surrounded by his closest friends, united by laughter and shared experiences, solidified the importance of connection and community in William's life.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable person who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to spend time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the thrill of the game.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

He took on extra shifts at the local fish market, his hands growing rough and calloused as he unloaded crates and gutted fish, determined to help his family weather the storm.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
