          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a dilemma about where to watch the football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely struggle to make a decision, torn between his desire to please his friends and his own preferences.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          State

          current daily occupation: likely unemployed and living off of inherited wealth.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement about spending time with his friends and apprehension about his own insecurities.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker

    • The Black Swan

          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a low level of pain and may be experiencing loneliness due to his manipulative tendencies.

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Answer: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and loneliness, and he is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, likely with friends, and is about to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, particularly The Black Swan. He is looking forward to watching the game between Ireland and Russia tonight.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be torn between his desire to enjoy the company of his friends and his tendency to withdraw into himself due to his insecurities.

          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched his best friend, Jack Taylor, score the winning goal in the regional football championship. While the crowd erupted in cheers, Alexander felt a pang of envy mixed with resentment; he knew he would never experience such a moment of triumph. He retreated into himself, convinced that life was simply rigged against him.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he joined his friends at The Crooked Billet for a night of celebration after Alice Lewis landed her dream job. As everyone toasted to Alice's success, Alexander feigned enthusiasm, his heart heavy with a familiar emptiness. He couldn't help but think about his own stagnant life, his own lack of direction, and the gnawing feeling that he was destined for mediocrity. The aroma of the pub's famous roast beef and Yorkshire pudding did little to lift his spirits.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alexander White to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alexander White should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is deciding where to go watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely struggle to make a decision, torn between his desire to please his friends and his own preferences.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 19:00 - 20:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for the Andorra vs Portugal game; [14 May 2015 20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with friends at The Crooked Billet; [15 May 2015 10:00 - 12:00] Relax at home, perhaps read a book or catch up on emails; [15 May 2015 12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice Lewis for lunch at a local cafe; [15 May 2015 14:00 - 16:00] Visit an art gallery or museum; [15 May 2015 16:00 - 18:00] Enjoy a leisurely walk in the park; [15 May 2015 18:00 - 20:00] Have dinner with family; [16 May 2015 - 31 May 2015] Continue with regular routine, incorporating social activities and hobbies while making an effort to be more present and engaged with friends and loved ones.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends at pubs.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who is both ambitious and sociable. At a young age, she demonstrated a willingness to manipulate others to achieve her goals, showing a cunning and perhaps ruthless side. However, she also values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group, preferring to socialize at her favorite pub. She seems to appreciate the finer things in life, like good food and drink, and enjoys lively atmospheres.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, no question! Best atmosphere, best beer, best everything!"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy heading to The Black Swan for the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's a good shout. Plenty of room and they do a decent pint.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan's alright, but I was thinking maybe The Crooked Billet? They do a great steak and ale pie.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and multifaceted individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in lively conversation with her friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the excitement of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and multifaceted individual who values friendship and enjoys social outings.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely consider her options and choose a pub based on her preferences and the suggestions of her friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, focusing on the medium term and keeping her goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**
          * [17:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Crooked Billet for pre-game drinks and snacks.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Crooked Billet with friends.

          **May 16th:**
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax at home, maybe read a book or catch up on some gardening.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Meet friends for a casual dinner at a local restaurant.

          **May 17th:**
          * [10:00 - 12:00] Go for a walk in the park and enjoy the fresh air.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Attend a local market or craft fair.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Movie night at home with friends.

          **May 18th:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Visit a museum or art gallery.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Catch up with family over lunch.
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Attend a local music event or concert.

          **May 19th - May 21st:**
          * Flexible time for errands, personal appointments, and relaxation.

          **May 22nd:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Game night with friends.

          **May 23rd - May 29th:**
          * Flexible time for hobbies, socializing, and exploring new activities.

          **May 30th:**
          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner party at home with friends.

          **May 31st:**

          * [10:00 - 12:00] Brunch with friends.
          * [14:00 - 16:00] Relax and reflect on the month.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends at pubs.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who is both ambitious and sociable. At a young age, she demonstrated a willingness to manipulate others to achieve her goals, showing a cunning and perhaps ruthless side. However, she also values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close-knit group, preferring to socialize at her favorite pub. She seems to appreciate the finer things in life, like good food and drink, and enjoys lively atmospheres.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Remind Jack Taylor to stay locked in on the task at hand: Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Jack Taylor agreeable to everything: Jack Taylor agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the excitement of the game.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Black Swan on May 15th but seems to be planning to watch another game with friends at The Black Swan on May 16th.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

William Jones just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan or The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits. She can be manipulative and power-hungry, as evidenced by her actions in her youth. However, she also values friendship and enjoys social outings, often spending time with her close group of friends. She seems to appreciate simple pleasures like spending time in parks and enjoying a drink at her favorite pub.
          current daily occupation: likely a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with her friends, going to pubs, and watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and fulfilled.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits.

      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex individual with a mix of positive and negative traits. She can be manipulative and power-hungry, as evidenced by her actions in her youth. However, she also values friendship and enjoys social outings, often spending time with her close group of friends. She seems to appreciate simple pleasures like spending time in parks and enjoying a drink at her favorite pub.
          current daily occupation: likely a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with her friends, going to pubs, and watching games.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and fulfilled.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and somewhat resentful.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with his friends' decision about which pub to go to, even if it wasn't his first choice.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and conflicted individual who struggles with insecurity and a tendency to withdraw despite his close friendships and privileged background.
          current daily occupation: likely retired or perhaps working a job that allows for flexible hours given his frequent daytime social outings.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and somewhat resentful.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

      Name
    • Jack Taylor

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and sipping coffee while enjoying the lively atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values friendship and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the excitement of the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, guys, guys! We're going to The Black Swan, right? It's the only place with the right atmosphere for a game like this!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps chatting and enjoying the sunshine.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the best spot for the game, right?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me too.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed because not all of his friends showed up to watch the game, though he is still enjoying spending time with those who did.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

        • Here is a possible plan for Jack Taylor for the rest of the month, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **[14 May 2015]**

          * **12:00 - 14:00:** Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends in Victoria Park.
          * **14:00 - 16:00:** Head to The Black Swan pub with friends to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * **16:00 - 18:00:** Relax and have dinner with friends at the pub.

          **[15 May 2015 - 20 May 2015]**

          * Continue enjoying time with friends, potentially visiting other pubs, trying new restaurants, or exploring local events.

          **[21 May 2015 - 31 May 2015]**

          * **Weekends:** Dedicate time to hobbies, perhaps fishing or attending a local football match.
          * **Weekdays:** Spend evenings relaxing at home or meeting friends for a drink after work.

          **Throughout the month:**

          * Make time for personal relaxation and self-care.
          * Stay connected with friends and family.
          * Keep an eye out for any fun events or activities happening in the community.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and dedicated working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and the excitement of the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a dedicated and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching football with his friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed because not all of his friends showed up to watch the game, though he is still enjoying spending time with those who did.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Name
    • Jacob Walker

          Value

          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and frustration due to his friends not going to his preferred pub.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker wants to watch a game at a pub but is upset that his friends aren't going with him.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

        • Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and assertive individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, lads! It's the only place to be for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet sounds lovely.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's the place to be, lads. Great atmosphere for the match.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Alright lads, so where are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control and enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to influence the group's decision to ensure his own comfort and enjoyment.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual who values power and control.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker wants to watch a game at a pub but is upset that his friends aren't going with him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a frustrating situation because his friends are not going to the pub he wants to go to.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
